question: If the distance between the earth and the sun becomes one-fourth of what it is now, the gravitational force exerted on the earth by the sun would be:
option1: One-fourth of what it is now
option2: One-sixteenth of what it is now
option3: Sixteen times of what it is now
option4: Four times of what it is now
answer: Sixteen times of what it is now
explanation: Gravitational force is inversely proportional to the square of the distance between the bodies.
